original: mantra a'i shva r'i b'a ts'a /
analyzed: mantra a'i shva r'i b'a ts'a /
translated: mantra īśvarī vāca

original: zhes pa'i sngags 'di lan bdun bzlas te nas la phu btab /
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags 'di lan bdun bzlas te nas la phu btab /
translated: Recite this mantra seven times and blow on the barley.

original: tshad pa'i rims nyin gcig pa /
analyzed: tshad pa'i rims nyin gcig pa /
translated: If the patient has a fever that lasts one day,

original: gnyis pa / gsum pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa / gsum pa /
translated: two days, three days,🔽or four days,

original: bzhi pa rnams gcig la phyi ma phan /🔽pa'i tshad rims rnams kyis na bar /
analyzed: bzhi pa rnams gcig la phyi ma phan / pa'i tshad rims rnams kyis na bar /
translated: the following will definitely help.🔽A companion should first tie the patient’s head with a cloth and hold it.

original: zla bo zhig gis thog mar nad pa'i mgo bo ras kyis bsdams te bzung la rang gis sngags 'dren zhing phus btab pa'i nas nges mgo bo brab /
analyzed: zla bo zhig gis thog mar nad pa'i mgo bo ras kyis bsdams te bzung la rang gis sngags 'dren zhing phus btab pa'i nas nges mgo bo brab /
translated: The companion should recite the mantra and blow on the barley, and then hit the patient’s head with the barley.

original: de nas nad par nad ga na 'dug dris la mgo bo phan na skye /
analyzed: de nas nad par nad ga na 'dug dris la mgo bo phan na skye /
translated: Then ask the patient where the illness is. If it is in the head, it will swell.

original: de nas stod /🔽sked pa sogs rim bzhin ras kyis bsdams pa sbo zhing nas kyis brab pas mthar rkang pa'i mtheb mo'i bar byas pas nges par phan par 'gyur zhing slar yang mi 'byung ba'i ched du srad bur mdud pa bdun /
analyzed: de nas stod / sked pa sogs rim bzhin ras kyis bsdams pa sbo zhing nas kyis brab pas mthar rkang pa'i mtheb mo'i bar byas pas nges par phan par 'gyur zhing slar yang mi 'byung ba'i ched du srad bur mdud pa bdun /
translated: Then the upper part,🔽the waist, and so on should be tied with a cloth and hit with the barley.🔽Finally, tie the big toe with a thread.🔽Tie seven knots in the thread, and recite the mantra once for each knot.

original: mdud pa rer sngags tshar re bzlas pa'i phus btab pa rke la btags so //
analyzed: mdud pa rer sngags tshar re bzlas pa'i phus btab pa rke la btags so //
translated: Blow on the thread and tie it around the patient’s neck.

original: shin tu zab /
analyzed: shin tu zab /
translated: This is very profound.

original: grong dang grong rdal gang la'ang mi phyugs kyi rims bsrung bar 'dod na thog mar lcags kyi gzer sor bzhi pa gzer mgo can bzhi /
analyzed: grong dang grong rdal gang la'ang mi phyugs kyi rims bsrung bar 'dod na thog mar lcags kyi gzer sor bzhi pa gzer mgo can bzhi /
translated: If you wish to protect a town or a village from an epidemic among humans or animals, first prepare four iron nails four finger-widths long with their heads intact.

original: de'i gdan gro gar chos 'byung gru gsum nyis brtsegs bris pa bzhi /
analyzed: de'i gdan gro gar chos 'byung gru gsum nyis brtsegs bris pa bzhi /
translated: Make four seats for them, drawing a double-stacked tetrahedral source of phenomena in each of the four directions.

original: bya pho nag po gcig / chang bum pa gang /🔽nas / gro //
analyzed: bya pho nag po gcig / chang bum pa gang / nas / gro //
translated: Place a black rooster, a full beer jar,

original: sran chung ma /🔽sran ma / 'bras /
analyzed: sran chung ma / sran ma / 'bras /
translated: and a full jar of water.🔽Place a full jar of each of the following: peas,🔽beans, rice,

original: pad kha / bra'o //
analyzed: pad kha / bra'o //
translated: barley, and wheat.

original: gzhan 'bru sna gang 'dzom tshon pa re rnams sta gon byas /
analyzed: gzhan 'bru sna gang 'dzom tshon pa re rnams sta gon byas /
translated: Prepare whatever other grains you have.

original: tho rengs shin tu snga bar rang gi mchan khung g-yon du bya pho kha phyir bstan la bcug / lcags gzer dang dril bu lag g-yon gyis 'khrol zhing bzung /
analyzed: tho rengs shin tu snga bar rang gi mchan khung g-yon du bya pho kha phyir bstan la bcug / lcags gzer dang dril bu lag g-yon gyis 'khrol zhing bzung /
translated: Very early in the morning, place the rooster in your left armpit, facing out, and hold the iron nails and bells in your left hand, ringing them.

original: lag g-yas kyis 'bru sna 'thor zhing ngag bsdams la 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags 'dren /
analyzed: lag g-yas kyis 'bru sna 'thor zhing ngag bsdams la 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags 'dren /
translated: With your right hand, scatter the grains and recite the following mantra in silence.

original: zla bo zhig la chang bum bskur la des ku sha lta bus rang gang 'gro'i rjes la chang 'thor zhing yong /
analyzed: zla bo zhig la chang bum bskur la des ku sha lta bus rang gang 'gro'i rjes la chang 'thor zhing yong /
translated: Have a companion follow you, pouring beer with a kusha grass tube.

original: @323b thog ma grong khyer gyi shar du slebs pa dang grogs chos 'byung gi re kh'a can sar bzhag / de steng 'bru sna cung zad blug cing chang gtor te chos 'byung gi dkyil du lcags gzer 'debs shing sngags tshar gcig 'don pa slar yang 'bru sna dang
analyzed: @323b thog ma grong khyer gyi shar du slebs pa dang grogs chos 'byung gi re kh'a can sar bzhag / de steng 'bru sna cung zad blug cing chang gtor te chos 'byung gi dkyil du lcags gzer 'debs shing sngags tshar gcig 'don pa slar yang 'bru sna dang
translated: On top of that, pour a little bit of grain and alcohol. Drive a nail in the center of the source of phenomena and recite the mantra once. Again, pour a little bit of grain and alcohol and set it aside.

original: chang cung zad blugs nas bzhag / de nas lho //
analyzed: chang cung zad blugs nas bzhag / de nas lho //
translated: Then, go to the south, west, and so on, in sequence.🔽After driving the nails in the above manner, when you arrive at the north, place the nail in the source of phenomena in the sleeping position and recite the mantra while pouring grain and alcohol.

original: nub rnams rim par gzer 'debs lugs sogs gong ltar byas rjes byang du sleb pa dang gzer chos 'byung gi steng du nyal stabs su bzhag la sngags 'dren zhing 'bru sna dang chang blug / sngags tshar gcig song ba dang / gro ga / gzer /
analyzed: nub rnams rim par gzer 'debs lugs sogs gong ltar byas rjes byang du sleb pa dang gzer chos 'byung gi steng du nyal stabs su bzhag la sngags 'dren zhing 'bru sna dang chang blug / sngags tshar gcig song ba dang / gro ga / gzer /
translated: When one round of the mantra is finished, take the parchment, nail,

original: 'bru sna'i lhag / chang dang bcas khyer la lung stong mi med sa zhig tu phyin la bya pho kha phyir bstan la slong /
analyzed: 'bru sna'i lhag / chang dang bcas khyer la lung stong mi med sa zhig tu phyin la bya pho kha phyir bstan la slong /
translated: excess grain, and alcohol, and go to an empty valley with no people. Turn the rooster to face outward and summon him.

original: de rjes su chang dang 'bru sna'i lhag pho la khyim du log / thog ma khyim nas thon nas nang du ma sleb bar ngag dang phyir mig ma shor ba gal che zhing /
analyzed: de rjes su chang dang 'bru sna'i lhag pho la khyim du log / thog ma khyim nas thon nas nang du ma sleb bar ngag dang phyir mig ma shor ba gal che zhing /
translated: It is very important that from the time you first leave home until you get back inside, you do not speak and do not look back.

original: nad log pa byung na slar yang 'dab bo //
analyzed: nad log pa byung na slar yang 'dab bo //
translated: If you get sick, you should do this again.

original: 'dis ni mi phyugs gang gi yang rims sogs 'gos nad kyi rigs bsrung ba mi thub pa mi srid pa shin tu zab po //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi phyugs gang gi yang rims sogs 'gos nad kyi rigs bsrung ba mi thub pa mi srid pa shin tu zab po //
translated: This is extremely profound and it is impossible that it will not protect you or your animals from contagious diseases such as the plague.🔽The mantra is:

original: sngags ni / aom aa sam ku pu tra brahm'a ki wa tsab'i  tsa de ;
analyzed: sngags ni / aom aa sam ku pu tra brahm'a ki wa tsab'i  tsa de ;
translated: Om asamputa brahma kiva chaya tade

analyzed: n'a ba ni ram ta rabha ye /
translated: navanirvartabhaya

analyzed: r'abna b'a d'i k'a ra na ka re ni ta sh'a dza la ga be /
translated: ravanavadakaraṇakare nitashājālagava

analyzed: aa tsal d'i thest'a ba na mi the ba ma ba na /
translated: acchadayatheṣṭāvanamithebhavam

original: pha la to da sha ai /
analyzed: pha la to da sha ai /
translated: phalatodasha i

analyzed: ai ka da b'i ka te tsa da sha ye /

analyzed: @326b  'khor lo 'di shog bur tshar gnyis dang li sder lta bu'i ngos su tshar gcig bris /
translated: write this wheel twice on paper and once on a slate.

original: shog bur bris pa gcig pa gcig khang pa'i phyi'i sa gang 'os su me la bsregs /
analyzed: shog bur bris pa gcig pa gcig khang pa'i phyi'i sa gang 'os su me la bsregs /
translated: Burn one of the paper copies outside the house in an appropriate place.

original: gcig nad pa'i mgul du btags /
analyzed: gcig nad pa'i mgul du btags /
translated: Tie the other one around the patient’s neck.

original: li sder la bris pa de chus bkrus te khu ba khong du btang /
analyzed: li sder la bris pa de chus bkrus te khu ba khong du btang /
translated: Wash the slate with water and drink the liquid.

original: de nas rkang lag gi sor mo bcu'i sen mo dang / spyi bo'i gtsug tu lcags tshugs re bzhag pas nges par phan no /
analyzed: de nas rkang lag gi sor mo bcu'i sen mo dang / spyi bo'i gtsug tu lcags tshugs re bzhag pas nges par phan no /
translated: Then place an iron needle on each of the ten fingernails and on the crown of the head. This will definitely help.

original: ` / skyes pa'i sgro ba skrangs pa dang /  ratama zha]  mi phyugs gang gi bu snod lugs pa la 'khor lo 'di lag mthil gnyis la bris /
analyzed: ` / skyes pa'i sgro ba skrangs pa dang /  ratama zha]  mi phyugs gang gi bu snod lugs pa la 'khor lo 'di lag mthil gnyis la bris /
translated: If a man’s scrotum or a woman’s womb is swollen, draw this wheel on the palms of both hands.

original: lhvam gang rung gi mthil me la bsregs pa'i thal ba dang snum bsres pa lag mthil du phur te sgro ba'am bu snod gang yin la rag la cung zad btsir btsir byas pas phan par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: lhvam gang rung gi mthil me la bsregs pa'i thal ba dang snum bsres pa lag mthil du phur te sgro ba'am bu snod gang yin la rag la cung zad btsir btsir byas pas phan par 'gyur ro /
translated: Mix the ashes of burnt barley or wheat chaff with oil, and rub it into the palms of the hands. Then, by pressing the palms together slightly, the swelling of the scrotum or womb will be relieved.🔽If a person has a severe eye disease, such as an eye tumor, draw this wheel with ink on the bottom of a wooden plate. Fill it with water and have the patient look into it.

original: ` / mig la sha cher gyi nad tshabs che ba byung na li sder gyi mthil du  'khor lo 'di snag tshas bris de'i nang du chu blug / de la nad pa bltar bcug / them mi gcig pa bdun nas nas kyi sog ma rkad re bslangs
analyzed: ` / mig la sha cher gyi nad tshabs che ba byung na li sder gyi mthil du  'khor lo 'di snag tshas bris de'i nang du chu blug / de la nad pa bltar bcug / them mi gcig pa bdun nas nas kyi sog ma rkad re bslangs
translated: Then, using a single match, light the end of each of seven blades of barley straw.

original: / rim bzhin sog ma re la me sbar te nad pa'i mgo bor lan gsum re bskor te chu nang du skyur bas chu'i mdog snum lta bur 'gyur 'gro zhing nad de phan par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: / rim bzhin sog ma re la me sbar te nad pa'i mgo bor lan gsum re bskor te chu nang du skyur bas chu'i mdog snum lta bur 'gyur 'gro zhing nad de phan par 'gyur ro /
translated: In turn, light the end of each blade of straw, circle the patient’s head three times, and spit into the water. The color of the water will turn oily, and the disease will be cured.

original: ` / rmi lam bzang ngan sna tshogs mang du rmis na /🔽'khor lo 'di gza' nyi ma'i nyin gro ga la dri brgyad kyis bris te rked [dd: 91/
analyzed: ` / rmi lam bzang ngan sna tshogs mang du rmis na / 'khor lo 'di gza' nyi ma'i nyin gro ga la dri brgyad kyis bris te rked [dd: 91/

write this wheel on birch bark with the eight scents on a Sunday and tie it around your waist.

analyzed: dzo gi ki /
translated: Jogiki.🔽Vacha.

original: b'a tsa / me ri /
analyzed: b'a tsa / me ri /
translated: Meri.🔽Bakta.

original: bakta / gu ru ki shakti /
analyzed: bakta / gu ru ki shakti /
translated: Guru kishkti.

original: phu ro mantra /
analyzed: phu ro mantra /
translated: Puro mantra.

original: aom na mo a'a de sha /
analyzed: aom na mo a'a de sha /
translated: Om namo 'desha.

original: zhes pa'i sngags 'di tshar re bzlas la lugs gzer la tho ba cung zad re brdeg / tshar bdun song ba dang sor do tsam gyi bar stim pas myur du phan cing /
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags 'di tshar re bzlas la lugs gzer la tho ba cung zad re brdeg / tshar bdun song ba dang sor do tsam gyi bar stim pas myur du phan cing /
translated: When seven [recitations] have passed, insert [the hammer] two finger-widths and it will quickly help.

original: gzer ma bung bar slar yang na bar mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: gzer ma bung bar slar yang na bar mi 'gyur ro /
translated: If the joint is not completely healed, one will not get sick again.

original: ` /'khor lo 'di gza' zla ba'i nyi na gro gar gi ham dang gur @330a * //🔽gum gyis bris la /
analyzed: ` /'khor lo 'di gza' zla ba'i nyi na gro gar gi ham dang gur @330a * // gum gyis bris la /
translated: Write this wheel on birch bark with saffron and vermilion on a Monday.

original: mgul du btags na bkra shis shing bsam pa'i don thams cad 'grub bo /
analyzed: mgul du btags na bkra shis shing bsam pa'i don thams cad 'grub bo /
translated: If it is worn around the neck, it is auspicious and all wished-for goals will be accomplished.

original: ` / lha mo dbu mas dbang phyug la gsol ba /
analyzed: ` / lha mo dbu mas dbang phyug la gsol ba /
translated: The middle goddess supplicated Maheśvara:

original: 'jig rten kun gyi byed po dbang phyug che //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyi byed po dbang phyug che //
translated: “The creator of all worlds is the great Maheśvara.

original: kun la phan phyir 'chi med tshe'i  bcud len //
analyzed: kun la phan phyir 'chi med tshe'i  bcud len //
translated: For the benefit of all, I request the elixir of immortality.

original: bskal pa bskal par rdo rje ltar gnas pa //
analyzed: bskal pa bskal par rdo rje ltar gnas pa //
translated: Abiding like a vajra for eons and eons,

original: nga yis 'dri yi khyod kyis bshad du gsol //
analyzed: nga yis 'dri yi khyod kyis bshad du gsol //
translated: I ask you to explain this.”

original: zhes gsol pas dbang phyug gis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhes gsol pas dbang phyug gis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Maheśvara replied:

original: nyon cig lha sras yid 'ong ma //
analyzed: nyon cig lha sras yid 'ong ma //
translated: “Listen, beautiful goddess!

original: kun phan 'chi med tshe'i bcud len //
analyzed: kun phan 'chi med tshe'i bcud len //
translated: For the benefit of all, the elixir of immortality.

original: karko ti yi cho ga rnams //
analyzed: karko ti yi cho ga rnams //
translated: The ritual of Karkoṭa

original: legs par bstan gyis yid la zung //
analyzed: legs par bstan gyis yid la zung //
translated: is well taught, so keep it in mind.

original: de la karko ti yod sar phyin la lus legs par bkrus te /
analyzed: de la karko ti yod sar phyin la lus legs par bkrus te /
translated: Go to a place where there is Karkoṭa, and thoroughly wash your body.

original: aom na mo ma he shvo ri siddhi shva ra bandha bandha hu hu phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom na mo ma he shvo ri siddhi shva ra bandha bandha hu hu phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Recite this mantra: Oṃ namo maheśvarasiddhīśvara bandha bandha hu hu phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes pa'i sngags 'di bzla zhing rtsa rtse ma lus pa brkos te gtsang sar grib bskam bya /
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags 'di bzla zhing rtsa rtse ma lus pa brkos te gtsang sar grib bskam bya /
translated: Dig up all the roots and tips, and dry them in the shade in a clean place.

original: bskams pa dang zhib par btags (gza' nyi ma yod pa'i dus) pa se ba bzhi tsam ba'i 'o ma dang sbrang rtsir sbyar /
analyzed: bskams pa dang zhib par btags (gza' nyi ma yod pa'i dus) pa se ba bzhi tsam ba'i 'o ma dang sbrang rtsir sbyar /
translated: When they are dry, grind them into a fine powder. Mix four tolas of this with cow’s milk and honey.

original: nang 'gol sar mtshams bcad /
analyzed: nang 'gol sar mtshams bcad /
translated: In a secluded place, do the boundary protection.

original: 'bras btsos pa dang ba'i 'o ma cung zad re las gzhan za btung gi rigs mi byed cing khyad par tshva ma shor ba gal che zhing tho rengs thang re gtong ba zla ba drug gi bar bsten pas zla ba bzhi song ba dang / skra /🔽kha spu / ba spu sogs /
analyzed: 'bras btsos pa dang ba'i 'o ma cung zad re las gzhan za btung gi rigs mi byed cing khyad par tshva ma shor ba gal che zhing tho rengs thang re gtong ba zla ba drug gi bar bsten pas zla ba bzhi song ba dang / skra / kha spu / ba spu sogs /
translated: Cook rice and add a little cow’s milk. Do not eat or drink anything else. In particular, it is very important not to eat salty foods. Take this medicine at dawn. Take it for six months. After four months, all the hair on your body,🔽including your head hair,🔽beard, and body hair,

original: lus kyi spu thams cad byi 'gro zhing /
analyzed: lus kyi spu thams cad byi 'gro zhing /
translated: will fall out.

original: de nas zla ba phyed gnyis tshun la skra dang kha spu sogs gsar pa shin tu legs pa skyel /
analyzed: de nas zla ba phyed gnyis tshun la skra dang kha spu sogs gsar pa shin tu legs pa skyel /
translated: Then, within two half months, the hair and beard will grow back very well.

original: skyes pa dang zla ba phyed gnyis kyi bar karko ta'i 'bru kho na zhib par btags pa thun tshad gong bzhin sbrang rtsi dang bsres pa zos pas lus yang ba dang / gzi brjid che ba dang / sems bde ba dang / nad med pa sogs 'byung zhing /
analyzed: skyes pa dang zla ba phyed gnyis kyi bar karko ta'i 'bru kho na zhib par btags pa thun tshad gong bzhin sbrang rtsi dang bsres pa zos pas lus yang ba dang / gzi brjid che ba dang / sems bde ba dang / nad med pa sogs 'byung zhing /
translated: When they have grown, for two half months he should eat only the paste of the fruit of the karakota plant, as above, mixed with honey. By eating this, the body becomes light, there is great splendor, the mind is happy, there is no illness, and so on.

original: bya rog gnyis kyi tshe tshad ste lo stong gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya rog gnyis kyi tshe tshad ste lo stong gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will live for two thousand years, the life span of two crows.

original: de nas zla ba gnyis dang zhag nyi shu'i bar 'bras bu mar dang bsres pa bsten @330b pas bya rog gnyis kyi tshe tshad ste lo nyis stong thub cing nyis stong du slebs pa dang gnyid du song ba lta bu'i lus sems ma bral kyang smra brjod sogs
analyzed: de nas zla ba gnyis dang zhag nyi shu'i bar 'bras bu mar dang bsres pa bsten @330b pas bya rog gnyis kyi tshe tshad ste lo nyis stong thub cing nyis stong du slebs pa dang gnyid du song ba lta bu'i lus sems ma bral kyang smra brjod sogs
translated: Then, for two months and twenty days, he should rely on the fruit mixed with ghee. By doing this, he will live for four thousand years, the life span of four crows. When he reaches four thousand years, he will experience a state like sleep, in which the body and mind are not separated, but he is unable to speak and so on.

original: mi thub pa zhig 'ong bas karko ta'i 'bru dang dngul chu /
analyzed: mi thub pa zhig 'ong bas karko ta'i 'bru dang dngul chu /
translated: Therefore, he should eat the fruit of the karakota plant, mercury, and ghee.

original: mu zi ser po gsum cha mnyam bhringga r'a dza'i khu bas rta byas nas gtong lugs slob ma lta bur bslabs la bzhag / de nas dran pa rnyed pa dang de ga'i mu 'thud la lo gcig gi bar zos pas lo bzhi stong thub cing /
analyzed: mu zi ser po gsum cha mnyam bhringga r'a dza'i khu bas rta byas nas gtong lugs slob ma lta bur bslabs la bzhag / de nas dran pa rnyed pa dang de ga'i mu 'thud la lo gcig gi bar zos pas lo bzhi stong thub cing /
translated: Then, when one regains consciousness, one should continue to eat it for a year. By doing so, one will live for four thousand years.

original: de nas kyang mu 'thud du zos pas chu la mi 'bying /
analyzed: de nas kyang mu 'thud du zos pas chu la mi 'bying /
translated: Then, by continuing to eat it, one will not sink in water.

original: mkha' la bya ltar 'phur ba dang / lus la me chu mtshon la sogs pas mi phigs te /
analyzed: mkha' la bya ltar 'phur ba dang / lus la me chu mtshon la sogs pas mi phigs te /
translated: One will fly like a bird in the sky, and one’s body will not be harmed by fire, water, weapons, and so on.

original: de ni lus rdo rje dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de ni lus rdo rje dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: This is the body that is like a vajra.

original: kye rigs sras lha mo //
analyzed: kye rigs sras lha mo //
translated: O son of noble family, goddess!

original: 'di'i nus pa dang phan yon ni tshul bzhin du ngas kyang brjod par mi nus mod /
analyzed: 'di'i nus pa dang phan yon ni tshul bzhin du ngas kyang brjod par mi nus mod /
translated: Although I am unable to describe its power and benefits properly,

original: 'on kyang cho ga sogs rags pa tsam zhig bstan zin gyis snying dang 'dra bar chongs la 'gro ba'i don gyis shig ces gdams so /
analyzed: 'on kyang cho ga sogs rags pa tsam zhig bstan zin gyis snying dang 'dra bar chongs la 'gro ba'i don gyis shig ces gdams so /
translated: nevertheless, I have taught the rough procedure and so on. Cherish it like your heart and benefit migrating beings.”

original: ` /'khor lo 'di gro ga 'am shog bu la ba'i 'o mas bris [dd: 18/
analyzed: ` /'khor lo 'di gro ga 'am shog bu la ba'i 'o mas bris [dd: 18/
translated: This wheel should be written with goat’s milk on birch bark or paper.

original: 25/ 2/ 7/ 6/ 25/ 2/ 7/ 6/  3/ 22/ 21/ 24/ 25/ 2/ 7/ 6/ 25/ 2/ 7/ 6/  3/ 22/ 21/ 24/  19/ 8/ 1/ 4/  5/ 20/ 23/] la srad bu dkar pos bcings te btags na nad rims thams cad thub cing yid la 'dod pa 'grub bo /
analyzed: 25/ 2/ 7/ 6/ 25/ 2/ 7/ 6/  3/ 22/ 21/ 24/ 25/ 2/ 7/ 6/ 25/ 2/ 7/ 6/  3/ 22/ 21/ 24/  19/ 8/ 1/ 4/  5/ 20/ 23/] la srad bu dkar pos bcings te btags na nad rims thams cad thub cing yid la 'dod pa 'grub bo /
translated: If one ties it with a white thread and wears it, one will be able to overcome all epidemics and accomplish one’s wishes.

original: ` /'khor lo 'di t'a la'i lo ma'am gro ga la mu zi ser pos bris la btags na shin tu mgyogs pas rkang pa na bar mi 'gyur  ro /
analyzed: ` /'khor lo 'di t'a la'i lo ma'am gro ga la mu zi ser pos bris la btags na shin tu mgyogs pas rkang pa na bar mi 'gyur  ro /
translated: If one writes this cakra on a palm leaf or birch bark with yellow bitumen and wears it, one will not suffer from foot pain due to excessive walking.

original: ` / tsa kra 'di gro ga la gi ham gyis  bris la srad bu dkar pos bcings te btags na rgyal po dang blon po dbang du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: ` / tsa kra 'di gro ga la gi ham gyis  bris la srad bu dkar pos bcings te btags na rgyal po dang blon po dbang du 'gyur ro /
translated: If one writes this cakra on birch bark with ghee and wears it, having tied it with a white thread, one will be able to enthrall kings and ministers.

original: ` /'khor lo 'di shog bu la /
analyzed: ` /'khor lo 'di shog bu la /
translated: This cakra should be written on paper

original: tsan dan dmar po //
analyzed: tsan dan dmar po //
translated: with red sandalwood,

original: gi ham ga bur /
analyzed: gi ham ga bur /
translated: camphor,

original: aa ka ru gla rtsi gu gul gur gum @331a * //
analyzed: aa ka ru gla rtsi gu gul gur gum @331a * //
translated: agaru, musk, gugul, and saffron.

original: rnams  kyis bris la mgul du btags na gang 'dod pa dbang du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rnams  kyis bris la mgul du btags na gang 'dod pa dbang du 'gyur ro /
translated: If one wears it around one’s neck, one will be able to enthrall whomever one desires.

original: `  /'khor lo 'di gro ga 'am sindh'u ras bris te gu gul gyi dud pa btang ste lag pa g-yas la btags na bud med dbang du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: `  /'khor lo 'di gro ga 'am sindh'u ras bris te gu gul gyi dud pa btang ste lag pa g-yas la btags na bud med dbang du 'gyur ro /
translated: Write this wheel on birchbark or on sindūra. If you burn bdellium incense and tie it to your right arm, you will enthrall women.

original: ` /'khor lo 'di shog bu la ri dvags kyi khrag gis bris te btags na ri dvags  'bros par 'gyur ro /🔽` 'khor lo 'di  gro ga 'am shog bu la dri brgyad kyis bris te btags
analyzed: ` /'khor lo 'di shog bu la ri dvags kyi khrag gis bris te btags na ri dvags  'bros par 'gyur ro / ` 'khor lo 'di  gro ga 'am shog bu la dri brgyad kyis bris te btags
translated: Write this wheel on paper with the blood of a deer. If you tie it on, the deer will flee.

original: na 'byung bo dang yi dvags kyi gnod pa mi 'byung ngo /
analyzed: na 'byung bo dang yi dvags kyi gnod pa mi 'byung ngo /
translated: Write this wheel on birchbark or paper with the eight scents. If you tie it on, you will not be harmed by bhūtas or pretas.

original: ` /'khor lo 'di gi ham gis gro ga la bris te btags na grags pa che bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: ` /'khor lo 'di gi ham gis gro ga la bris te btags na grags pa che bar 'gyur ro /
translated: Write this wheel with guggulu on birchbark. If you tie it on, you will become famous.

original: ` / ri sgog rtsa rtse ma rnying sa ma rul ba grib bskam byas la zhib par btags /
analyzed: ` / ri sgog rtsa rtse ma rnying sa ma rul ba grib bskam byas la zhib par btags /
translated: Take old, dried, unrotten roots of mountain garlic, grind them into a fine powder,

original: ba mar gsar pas rta byas la ril bu skyu ru ra tsam re btang na grang ba dang rlung gi rigs mtha' dag la phan zhing lus kyi stobs 'phel zhing 'dod pa spyod mi nus pa yang nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba mar gsar pas rta byas la ril bu skyu ru ra tsam re btang na grang ba dang rlung gi rigs mtha' dag la phan zhing lus kyi stobs 'phel zhing 'dod pa spyod mi nus pa yang nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: and make pills the size of a jujube fruit with fresh cow butter. If you take one, it will benefit all kinds of cold and wind disorders, increase the body’s strength, and even enable you to have sex, even if you were previously unable to do so.

original: gong gi ri sgog sbrang rtsis rta byas nas btang na bud med zla mtshan ma babs pa'i khrag gi nad la mchog tu phan no //
analyzed: gong gi ri sgog sbrang rtsis rta byas nas btang na bud med zla mtshan ma babs pa'i khrag gi nad la mchog tu phan no //
translated: If one rides a horse with the above-mentioned garlic and honey, it is extremely beneficial for the blood disorders of women who have not had their period.

original: chu grang gis rta byas nas sna khrag gang gis kyang mchod pa'i snar blug na myur du chod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu grang gis rta byas nas sna khrag gang gis kyang mchod pa'i snar blug na myur du chod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one inserts it into the nose with cold water as the vehicle, it will quickly stop any type of nosebleed.

original: yang sna khrag kyang 'dzag cing mgo bo na na /
analyzed: yang sna khrag kyang 'dzag cing mgo bo na na /
translated: Also, if one has a nosebleed and a headache,

original: ri sgog gi 'bras bu mar @331b btsags bcad pa'i nang du ma tshig par btsos pa dang pi pi ling cha mnyam pa zhib bar btags pa bod kyi thun tshad gsum tsam re khong du btang bas khrag chod cing nad kyang phan no //
analyzed: ri sgog gi 'bras bu mar @331b btsags bcad pa'i nang du ma tshig par btsos pa dang pi pi ling cha mnyam pa zhib bar btags pa bod kyi thun tshad gsum tsam re khong du btang bas khrag chod cing nad kyang phan no //
translated: grind the fruit of garlic, unhusked rice, and pippali in equal parts, and take three Tibetan measures of the fine powder internally. It will stop the bleeding and benefit the disease.

original: zhum bu'i lce grib skam byas la zhib par btags la se ba bcu drug tsam re btang na ma'i khong nas smra mi shes pa'i lkugs pa kha 'bye bar 'gyur zhing dbang po yang gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhum bu'i lce grib skam byas la zhib par btags la se ba bcu drug tsam re btang na ma'i khong nas smra mi shes pa'i lkugs pa kha 'bye bar 'gyur zhing dbang po yang gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Make a powder of dried cat tongue and take about sixteen se measures. It will open the mouth of a mute who cannot speak from within the mother's womb and will also clarify the senses.

original: zhum bu'i khrag ma rul ba grib bskam byas te zhib par btags la mig la btab na sha 'dzer ling tog sogs mig nad mtha' dag la phan no //
analyzed: zhum bu'i khrag ma rul ba grib bskam byas te zhib par btags la mig la btab na sha 'dzer ling tog sogs mig nad mtha' dag la phan no //
translated: If one smears the eye with the finely ground, dried, and unspoiled blood of a cat, it will help all eye diseases such as eye-lid adhesions, eye-lid swelling, and so forth.

original: mgo bo sman gang btang kyang mi phan par na ba la zhum bu'i pags pa'i zhva gyon na phan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgo bo sman gang btang kyang mi phan par na ba la zhum bu'i pags pa'i zhva gyon na phan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one suffers from a headache that does not respond to any medicine, one will be helped if one wears a shoe made of cat skin.

original: skra dang rgya kha spu sogs med par 'dod na thog mar legs par bzhar /
analyzed: skra dang rgya kha spu sogs med par 'dod na thog mar legs par bzhar /
translated: If one wishes to be free of hair, beard, body hair, and so forth, first one should apply oil well.

original: de nas pha wang gi klad pas bsku mnye thengs gsum tsam re byas na phyis nas skye bar mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de nas pha wang gi klad pas bsku mnye thengs gsum tsam re byas na phyis nas skye bar mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: Then, if one massages three times with the brains of a bat, later they will not grow.

original: / pha wang gi phrug gu'i ro ma me la bsregs pa'i thal ba mig la byugs na /🔽steng 'grib / bar 'grib /
analyzed: / pha wang gi phrug gu'i ro ma me la bsregs pa'i thal ba mig la byugs na / steng 'grib / bar 'grib /
translated: If one smears the ashes of a roasted dead bat fetus on the eyes,🔽it will help all eye diseases such as upper cataracts, lower cataracts,

original: sha 'dzer / ling tog / skrangs pa sogs mig nad mtha' dag la phan no //
analyzed: sha 'dzer / ling tog / skrangs pa sogs mig nad mtha' dag la phan no //
translated: eye-lid adhesions, eye-lid swelling, and so forth.

original: sbrul gyi khrag dang byi ba'i khrag bsres pa sna mdog dmar por 'gyur zhing za phrug gis na ba la byugs na myur du phan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbrul gyi khrag dang byi ba'i khrag bsres pa sna mdog dmar por 'gyur zhing za phrug gis na ba la byugs na myur du phan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Mix the blood of a snake and a rat. If you apply this to a red-colored nose that itches, it will quickly help.

original: bud med sbrum ma btsa' ma thub pa dang bu ro ma thon par sbrul gyi klad pa mo mtshan gyi nang du byugs na myur du thon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med sbrum ma btsa' ma thub pa dang bu ro ma thon par sbrul gyi klad pa mo mtshan gyi nang du byugs na myur du thon par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a woman in labor or a woman who has not delivered the placenta smears the snake’s brain into her vagina, she will quickly deliver.

original: sbrul gyi pags pa mer bsregs pa'i thal bas mig dmar por song zhing na ba la phan no //
analyzed: sbrul gyi pags pa mer bsregs pa'i thal bas mig dmar por song zhing na ba la phan no //
translated: The ashes of a snake’s skin burned in fire will help a red and painful eye.

original: rnga mong gi klad pa se ba bcu drug tsam re khong du btang na rlung gi nad mtha' dag la phan zhing mig sheng chung ba'ang che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnga mong gi klad pa se ba bcu drug tsam re khong du btang na rlung gi nad mtha' dag la phan zhing mig sheng chung ba'ang che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you ingest sixteen small pieces of camel brain, it will help all types of wind disorders and will make small eyes larger.

original: rnga mong gi spu mer bsregs pa'i thal ba sna bug gi nang du phus btab na sna khrag ma chod pa myur du chod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnga mong gi spu mer bsregs pa'i thal ba sna bug gi nang du phus btab na sna khrag ma chod pa myur du chod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you blow the ashes of a camel’s hair burned in fire into your nostrils, it will quickly stop an uncontrollable nosebleed.

original: gos dar bsregs pa'i thal ba snar btab kyang nus pa gong dang 'dra /
analyzed: gos dar bsregs pa'i thal ba snar btab kyang nus pa gong dang 'dra /
translated: The ashes of burned silk applied to the nose have the same effect.

original: yang na chu bal sngon po spyi bor bkab kyang chod do //
analyzed: yang na chu bal sngon po spyi bor bkab kyang chod do //
translated: Alternatively, even if the blue water moss is placed on the head, it will be cured.

original: yang chu bal dang shing kun mnyam du btags la chur sbyar ba'i skyo ma @332a * //
analyzed: yang chu bal dang shing kun mnyam du btags la chur sbyar ba'i skyo ma @332a * //
translated: Furthermore, blue water moss and shingkun are tied together and the decoction is added to water.

original: mer bsros pa'i dron mo so gang na sar byugs na phral du phan par 'gyur ro //🔽ni la ka wang gi rtsa ba /
analyzed: mer bsros pa'i dron mo so gang na sar byugs na phral du phan par 'gyur ro // ni la ka wang gi rtsa ba /
translated: The warm water that is heated by a fire is applied to the site of the boil. It will be cured immediately.

original: lo ma / rkang rnams cha mnyam zhib par btags pa cha gcig / shing kun dang snum cha bzhi bsres pa lte bar byugs na sbos khrog rlung gi rigs mtha' dag la phan /
analyzed: lo ma / rkang rnams cha mnyam zhib par btags pa cha gcig / shing kun dang snum cha bzhi bsres pa lte bar byugs na sbos khrog rlung gi rigs mtha' dag la phan /
translated: The root, leaf, and stem of nilangka are taken in equal parts and finely ground. One part of this is mixed with four parts of shingkun and oil. When this is applied to the navel, it cures all types of baekan gyu.

original: phur mong ka ra dang bsres nas khong du btang na mkhris nad la phan /🔽su na na ba 'am /
analyzed: phur mong ka ra dang bsres nas khong du btang na mkhris nad la phan / su na na ba 'am /
translated: When it is taken internally mixed with sugar, it cures tripa disorders.

original: sa kra / ghanda pu na zhes ming gi rnam grangs /🔽ra'i mar dang sbyar na mig gi ling tog la phan /🔽sbrang dang sbyar na mchi ma 'dzag pa la phan /
analyzed: sa kra / ghanda pu na zhes ming gi rnam grangs / ra'i mar dang sbyar na mig gi ling tog la phan / sbrang dang sbyar na mchi ma 'dzag pa la phan /
translated: It is also known as sunanaba, sakra, and gandhaphuna.🔽When it is mixed with sheep fat, it cures eye cataracts.🔽When it is mixed with honey, it cures excessive tearing.

original: til snum dang sbyar na mig gi za phrug la phan /
analyzed: til snum dang sbyar na mig gi za phrug la phan /
translated: When it is mixed with sesame oil, it cures eye worms.

original: chu dang sbyar na mig gi mthong snang skar ma 'dra ba la phan no //
analyzed: chu dang sbyar na mig gi mthong snang skar ma 'dra ba la phan no //
translated: If combined with water, it is beneficial for the visual appearance of stars.

original: zho'i chu dang sbyar na srod long la phan /
analyzed: zho'i chu dang sbyar na srod long la phan /
translated: If combined with whey, it is beneficial for night blindness.

original: zha nye'i brag zhun mdog dkar ba 'o ma 'dra ba mchog / gzhan brag zhun gyi rigs gang byung yang de'i khu bas yan lag la sogs mtha' dag la phan no //
analyzed: zha nye'i brag zhun mdog dkar ba 'o ma 'dra ba mchog / gzhan brag zhun gyi rigs gang byung yang de'i khu bas yan lag la sogs mtha' dag la phan no //
translated: White limestone, which resembles milk, is the best. Other types of limestone are beneficial for all limbs and so forth when used as a decoction.

original: zi ra dkar po //
analyzed: zi ra dkar po //
translated: White aconite

original: yung ba zho bzhi /
analyzed: yung ba zho bzhi /
translated: Four measures of soot

original: mudta sang gti lo phat ki zho re /
analyzed: mudta sang gti lo phat ki zho re /
translated: One measure of mudga, sangtika, and lopaṭa🔽One measure each of long pepper, apāmārga, and poria

original: gla sgang aa phim pho ris rnams rim (gcig kyang khong par btang na bcud len gyi mchog) pas cha bskyung /
analyzed: gla sgang aa phim pho ris rnams rim (gcig kyang khong par btang na bcud len gyi mchog) pas cha bskyung /
translated: These are successively reduced in quantity.

original: de rnams thang tsam brdungs //
analyzed: de rnams thang tsam brdungs //
translated: When these are pounded into a powder,

original: grang 'thag mig la bdugs pas tsha ba dang / mig chu 'dzag pa dang / dmar por song ba la phan /
analyzed: grang 'thag mig la bdugs pas tsha ba dang / mig chu 'dzag pa dang / dmar por song ba la phan /
translated: Inhaling the steam from cold-pressed oil is beneficial for hot disorders, eye discharge, and redness.

original: shi la dzu yi khandha gdus pa'i thang //
analyzed: shi la dzu yi khandha gdus pa'i thang //
translated: A decoction of boiled shilajatu

original: khong du btang bas yan lag rtsa 'dar rnams //
analyzed: khong du btang bas yan lag rtsa 'dar rnams //
translated: When taken internally, it is beneficial for trembling of the limbs and channels.

original: bhi kha snum la btsos pas phyi la byugs //
analyzed: bhi kha snum la btsos pas phyi la byugs //
translated: Cooked in oil, it is applied externally.

original: phyi nang ltag sprad byas pas nges par phan //
analyzed: phyi nang ltag sprad byas pas nges par phan //
translated: When applied externally and internally, it will definitely be beneficial.

original: mgo dang yan lag rus chag la sogs dang // rtsa rgyus 'khum chad gsar rnying rma rigs la //
analyzed: mgo dang yan lag rus chag la sogs dang // rtsa rgyus 'khum chad gsar rnying rma rigs la //
translated: For broken bones, limbs, and so forth, and for the various types of wounds, old and new,

original: shi la dza dhu gdus pa'i thang de ni //
analyzed: shi la dza dhu gdus pa'i thang de ni //
translated: The decoction of shilajit, when boiled,

original: phyi la byugs dang khong du btang ba yis //
analyzed: phyi la byugs dang khong du btang ba yis //
translated: Is applied externally and taken internally.

original: de rnams kun la phan pa myong bas grub ;
analyzed: de rnams kun la phan pa myong bas grub ;
translated: It is proven by experience to be beneficial for all of these.

original: / shi la dza dhu gdus pa thang du btang //
analyzed: / shi la dza dhu gdus pa thang du btang //
translated: The decoction of shilajit, when boiled,

original: bu btsas sked pa na dang pho na 'joms //
analyzed: bu btsas sked pa na dang pho na 'joms //
translated: Cures pain in the waist and male organ after childbirth.

original: dug nyung phag brun sbre ro ma nyid brun /
analyzed: dug nyung phag brun sbre ro ma nyid brun /
translated: The dung of a pig, the dung of a goat, and the dung of a cow,

original: (/ byung na rab) cha mnyam nus ldan bsregs pa snum dang sbyar //🔽khong btang phyi la byugs pas zha grum nad //
analyzed: (/ byung na rab) cha mnyam nus ldan bsregs pa snum dang sbyar // khong btang phyi la byugs pas zha grum nad //
translated: When burned in equal parts with shilajit, is mixed with oil.🔽When taken internally and applied externally, it will definitely cure

original: gsar rnying kun la btang @332b bas 'joms par nges //
analyzed: gsar rnying kun la btang @332b bas 'joms par nges //
translated: All types of new and old gout.

original: glang chen lci ba'i dud pa mngal na btang //
analyzed: glang chen lci ba'i dud pa mngal na btang //
translated: The smoke of elephant dung, when inhaled during pregnancy,

original: bu dang sha ma phral du thon par nges /
analyzed: bu dang sha ma phral du thon par nges /
translated: Will definitely cause the child to be delivered with the placenta.

original: ` / bla ma dam pa'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: ` / bla ma dam pa'i zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the feet of the sublime guru.

original: grub thob chen po gorga n'a thas gsungs pa'i dri chu'i rtags la nyin re'i legs nyes brtag pa ni /
analyzed: grub thob chen po gorga n'a thas gsungs pa'i dri chu'i rtags la nyin re'i legs nyes brtag pa ni /
translated: The signs of urine spoken of by the great adept Gorakṣanātha for daily divination of good and bad are as follows.

original: dge slong lta bu khrims ldan la shin tu bden cing /
analyzed: dge slong lta bu khrims ldan la shin tu bden cing /
translated: For a monk who is keeping vows, this is very true.

original: khyim pa'ang brtag rung ba ste /
analyzed: khyim pa'ang brtag rung ba ste /
translated: It is also suitable for a layperson to examine.🔽The intention is to examine the first urine of the morning.

original: de yang tho rangs kyi dri chu thog ma la brtag pa byed rgyu'i dgongs nyal po drag shul chang 'thung ba sogs spang zhing /
analyzed: de yang tho rangs kyi dri chu thog ma la brtag pa byed rgyu'i dgongs nyal po drag shul chang 'thung ba sogs spang zhing /
translated: Avoid strenuous activity, alcohol, and so on.

original: srod 'khor tsam la dri chu lan gcig dor /
analyzed: srod 'khor tsam la dri chu lan gcig dor /
translated: At the end of the evening, urinate once.

original: de nas sang lus kyi ba spu mthong ba tsam la dri chu dor la de la brtag pa ste /
analyzed: de nas sang lus kyi ba spu mthong ba tsam la dri chu dor la de la brtag pa ste /
translated: Then, when you see the hairs on your body, urinate and examine it.

original: gsang gnas kyi kha nas dri chu g-yas ngos su 'khyogs nas 'gro na de'i nyin bkra shis shing bde legs dang ldan la bya ba gang brtsams kyang 'grub pa sogs shin tu legs so //
analyzed: gsang gnas kyi kha nas dri chu g-yas ngos su 'khyogs nas 'gro na de'i nyin bkra shis shing bde legs dang ldan la bya ba gang brtsams kyang 'grub pa sogs shin tu legs so //
translated: If the urine flows from the mouth of the urethra to the right side, then that day is auspicious, and whatever you undertake will be accomplished and so forth.

original: gzhogs g-yon du 'gro na 'thab mo dang rtsod pa dang 'phrog bcom sogs 'byung zhing bya ba brtsams kyang mi 'grub la /
analyzed: gzhogs g-yon du 'gro na 'thab mo dang rtsod pa dang 'phrog bcom sogs 'byung zhing bya ba brtsams kyang mi 'grub la /
translated: If the urine flows to the left side, there will be quarrels, disputes, robbery, and so on, and although one begins an undertaking, it will not be accomplished.

original: gtam mi snyan pa thos pa sogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gtam mi snyan pa thos pa sogs 'byung ngo //
translated: One will hear unpleasant news and so on.

original: chu bying thad kar 'gro zhing gsang gnas kyi mtshams nas 'og tu thigs pa babs na zas gos sogs yid dang mthun pa'i nor zhig nges par rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu bying thad kar 'gro zhing gsang gnas kyi mtshams nas 'og tu thigs pa babs na zas gos sogs yid dang mthun pa'i nor zhig nges par rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the urine flows straight ahead and a drop falls from the border of the genitals, one will definitely find wealth that is agreeable, such as food and clothing.

original: gsang gnas kyi mtshams nas chu rkang gcig la de nas gnyis su gyes shing slar gcig tu 'dril nas 'gro na nye du mdza' bshes sogs yid dang mthun pa'i mi phyogs su song ba zhig nges par 'khor zhing 'phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsang gnas kyi mtshams nas chu rkang gcig la de nas gnyis su gyes shing slar gcig tu 'dril nas 'gro na nye du mdza' bshes sogs yid dang mthun pa'i mi phyogs su song ba zhig nges par 'khor zhing 'phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the urine flows from the border of the genitals, then divides into two streams, and then merges into one stream, one will definitely meet someone who has gone to a place agreeable to one’s mind, such as a relative or friend.

original: thog mar 'dril zhing de nas leb mo srab por 'gro la slar yang 'dril nas 'gro na rgyal po'i chad pa'am rku jag stor ba sogs nor la god kha 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thog mar 'dril zhing de nas leb mo srab por 'gro la slar yang 'dril nas 'gro na rgyal po'i chad pa'am rku jag stor ba sogs nor la god kha 'byung ngo //
translated: If the urine first flows in a stream, then spreads out into a thin layer, and then again flows in a stream, there will be a loss of wealth, such as through royal punishment, thieves, or robbery.

original: chu bying lbu ba dang bcas nas 'gro zhing 'og tu thigs pa yang 'bab la sar babs pa rnams kyang 'khor zhing lbu ba dang bcas na char chen po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chu bying lbu ba dang bcas nas 'gro zhing 'og tu thigs pa yang 'bab la sar babs pa rnams kyang 'khor zhing lbu ba dang bcas na char chen po 'byung ngo //
translated: If the urine flows with bubbles and drips below, and the urine on the ground circles and has bubbles, then a great rain will occur.

original: sgra dang bcas te byung na mi 'gyangs par byes su 'gro dgos 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgra dang bcas te byung na mi 'gyangs par byes su 'gro dgos 'byung ngo //
translated: If it flows with a sound, then one must go away to a foreign land before long.

original: dgo ru ltar g-yon du gcus nas thad kar 'gro na de nyin nor stor ba rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //🔽chu phar mi 'gro ba gyen du tshur log nas gsang gnas kyi steng du 'bab na zhag @333a * //
analyzed: dgo ru ltar g-yon du gcus nas thad kar 'gro na de nyin nor stor ba rnyed par mi 'gyur ro // chu phar mi 'gro ba gyen du tshur log nas gsang gnas kyi steng du 'bab na zhag @333a * //
translated: If it flows straight ahead, having been twisted to the left like a goat, then one will not find the lost wealth that day.

original: bcu gsum song ba'i nyin nges par 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu gsum song ba'i nyin nges par 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the urine does not flow to the right, but returns to the left and falls on the genitals, then one will die on the thirteenth day.

original: g-yas su gcus nas 'gro na nor stor ba'ang zhag khungs 'dzol ba lta bu ma rnyed pa zhig rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yas su gcus nas 'gro na nor stor ba'ang zhag khungs 'dzol ba lta bu ma rnyed pa zhig rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it flows to the right, then one will find the lost wealth, like finding a lost path.

original: de rnams rnam dpyod dang ldan pas ma 'khrul bar brtags nas so sor bshad pa'i 'bras bu nges par 'byung ba ni myong bas grub pa'o /
analyzed: de rnams rnam dpyod dang ldan pas ma 'khrul bar brtags nas so sor bshad pa'i 'bras bu nges par 'byung ba ni myong bas grub pa'o /
translated: Those who are discerning should examine this without error and explain it individually. The results that definitely arise are established by experience.

original: ` / zhi ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: ` / zhi ba la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the peaceful one.

original: dga' byed kyi bden pa'i gtam rang gi lus kyi grib mar legs nyes brtag pa ni /
analyzed: dga' byed kyi bden pa'i gtam rang gi lus kyi grib mar legs nyes brtag pa ni /
translated: The story of the truth of the one who brings joy is the examination of good and bad in the shadow of one’s body.

original: tshes bco lnga'i mi khyi'i skad sogs sems can mi gnas pa'i rkyen med pa'i gnas dben par nam mkha' sprin dang khug rdul sogs kyi grib ma med pa'i shin tu dangs pa'i skabs brtag ste /
analyzed: tshes bco lnga'i mi khyi'i skad sogs sems can mi gnas pa'i rkyen med pa'i gnas dben par nam mkha' sprin dang khug rdul sogs kyi grib ma med pa'i shin tu dangs pa'i skabs brtag ste /
translated: On the fifteenth day of the month, in a place where there are no people, dogs, or other animals, in a secluded place, examine the very clear sky free of the shadows of clouds, fog, and so on.

original: lus gcer bur phyung la lus drong por bsrangs te langs lag pa gnyis cha mnyam du brkyangs /
analyzed: lus gcer bur phyung la lus drong por bsrangs te langs lag pa gnyis cha mnyam du brkyangs /
translated: Naked, stand with the body straight, the two arms extended equally,

original: zla ba rgyab tu khur te brtags la /
analyzed: zla ba rgyab tu khur te brtags la /
translated: and examine the moon carried on one’s back.

original: de yang thog mar sa la shar ba'i grib ma'i mthe bong nas rim bzhin gyen du 'dzegs te mig dang thad mnyam gyen phyogs kyi nam mkha' la grib ma sprin lta bu zhig 'char la /
analyzed: de yang thog mar sa la shar ba'i grib ma'i mthe bong nas rim bzhin gyen du 'dzegs te mig dang thad mnyam gyen phyogs kyi nam mkha' la grib ma sprin lta bu zhig 'char la /
translated: Moreover, first, the shadow that arises on the ground ascends in stages from the toe, and a shadow like a cloud arises in the sky above, at the level of the eyes.

original: de yang nam mkha' 'char ba'i grib ma der lus kyi dbyibs med par zla ba nya lta bu'i bzo dbyibs la shin tu dkar ba zhig snang na tshe ring nad med sdug bsngal mi 'byung /
analyzed: de yang nam mkha' 'char ba'i grib ma der lus kyi dbyibs med par zla ba nya lta bu'i bzo dbyibs la shin tu dkar ba zhig snang na tshe ring nad med sdug bsngal mi 'byung /
translated: If the moon is seen to be very white, like a full moon, without the shape of a body in the shadow of the rising moon, one will have a long life, good health, and no suffering.

original: bsod nams dang longs spyod mnga' thang rgyas /
analyzed: bsod nams dang longs spyod mnga' thang rgyas /
translated: One’s merit, wealth, and power will increase.

original: grags pas sa steng khyab pa sogs shin tu legs so //
analyzed: grags pas sa steng khyab pa sogs shin tu legs so //
translated: One’s fame will spread throughout the world.

original: lus gzhan mi gsal bar mgrin pa gcig po mthong na sems la sdug bsngal chen po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus gzhan mi gsal bar mgrin pa gcig po mthong na sems la sdug bsngal chen po 'byung ngo //
translated: If one’s body is not clear, but one sees only one neck, one will experience great mental suffering.

original: lus thams cad tshang zhing de yang skrangs pa'i dbyibs lta bu spom por mthong na myur du nad drag po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus thams cad tshang zhing de yang skrangs pa'i dbyibs lta bu spom por mthong na myur du nad drag po 'byung ngo //
translated: If one sees one’s entire body, but it is swollen like a boil, one will soon become very ill.

original: tshad  dbyibs sbom phra sogs rang gi lus dang mtshungs par mthong na nad mi 'byung zhing legs so //
analyzed: tshad  dbyibs sbom phra sogs rang gi lus dang mtshungs par mthong na nad mi 'byung zhing legs so //
translated: If one sees one’s body with its size, shape, thickness, and so on, just as it is, one will not become ill.

original: lus bying gsal la mgo bo med na zla ba drug nas nges par 'chi'o //
analyzed: lus bying gsal la mgo bo med na zla ba drug nas nges par 'chi'o //
translated: If one’s body is sunken and clear, but one’s head is missing, one will certainly die within six months.

original: lag pha gnyis mi gsal na rang la yang nad 'byung zhing spun zla gcig nges par 'chi'o //
analyzed: lag pha gnyis mi gsal na rang la yang nad 'byung zhing spun zla gcig nges par 'chi'o //
translated: If the two arms are unclear, you will become ill and one of your siblings will certainly die.

original: kha dog nag por snang na nor la god kha chen po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha dog nag por snang na nor la god kha chen po 'byung ngo //
translated: If the color appears black, there will be a great loss of wealth.

original: brla g-yas g-yon gang rigs la bug pa 'dug na chung ma nges par 'chi'o //
analyzed: brla g-yas g-yon gang rigs la bug pa 'dug na chung ma nges par 'chi'o //
translated: If there is a hole in either the right or left thigh, your wife will certainly die.

original: @333b lte ba'i thad du bug pa 'dug na 'thab mo dang kha mchu rtsod pa sogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @333b lte ba'i thad du bug pa 'dug na 'thab mo dang kha mchu rtsod pa sogs 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is a hole at the level of the navel, you will have quarrels, disputes, and so on.

original: grib ma shin tu ring zhing mgrin pa mi mthong na /
analyzed: grib ma shin tu ring zhing mgrin pa mi mthong na /
translated: If the shadow is very long and the neck is not seen,

original: yul gyi rgyal po sogs mi chen po zhig 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gyi rgyal po sogs mi chen po zhig 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the king of the country or some other great person will die.

original: sol ba'i mdog lta bu nag por mthong na /
analyzed: sol ba'i mdog lta bu nag por mthong na /
translated: If it is seen as black, like the color of charcoal,

original: sa zhing dang nor rdzas la sogs pa longs spyod gzhan gyis 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa zhing dang nor rdzas la sogs pa longs spyod gzhan gyis 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
translated: other people will steal your possessions, such as your land and wealth.

original: ser por mthong na gzhan gyi mi kha 'bab po //
analyzed: ser por mthong na gzhan gyi mi kha 'bab po //
translated: If it is seen as yellow, you will be slandered by others.

original: dkar por mthong na nad med cing longs spyod thob pa sogs mchog tu legs so //
analyzed: dkar por mthong na nad med cing longs spyod thob pa sogs mchog tu legs so //
translated: If it is seen as white, you will obtain health, wealth, and so on, and it is excellent in every way.

original: mig mi mthong na yid dang mthun pa'i mdza' grogs 'chi ba'am nor stor ba sogs kyis sems la sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig mi mthong na yid dang mthun pa'i mdza' grogs 'chi ba'am nor stor ba sogs kyis sems la sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
translated: If the eyes do not see, the mind is afflicted by the death of a beloved friend or the loss of wealth.

original: lus kyi cha shas thams cad tshang zhing gsal la kha dog dkar zhing bkrag dang ldan na lo drug tshun chad du 'chi pa'i 'jigs pa med cing nad drag po mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi cha shas thams cad tshang zhing gsal la kha dog dkar zhing bkrag dang ldan na lo drug tshun chad du 'chi pa'i 'jigs pa med cing nad drag po mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If all the parts of the body are complete, clear, white, and radiant, there is no danger of death within six years, and no severe illness will occur.

original: longs spyod dang snyan grags 'phel zhing bde skyid phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ba 'di yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dang snyan grags 'phel zhing bde skyid phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ba 'di yang dag pa'o //
translated: This is the truth that wealth, fame, and perfect happiness will increase and be attained.

original: zhes phyi nang drang srong gi tshe'i rig byed rgya mtsho lta bu'i nang nas mang dag yu la dbus 'gyur 'chang du gtsug lag gnyis pa shes pa'i mkhas mang la bsten nas dar rgyas su yod pa'i sman dpyad la mkhas pa kha ba can gyi ljongs 'dir du
analyzed: zhes phyi nang drang srong gi tshe'i rig byed rgya mtsho lta bu'i nang nas mang dag yu la dbus 'gyur 'chang du gtsug lag gnyis pa shes pa'i mkhas mang la bsten nas dar rgyas su yod pa'i sman dpyad la mkhas pa kha ba can gyi ljongs 'dir du
translated: Thus, in the midst of the ocean-like medical texts of the outer and inner sages, this text has been widely disseminated in the Central Land of Ü and Tsang, relying on many scholars who are like a second Buddha. In this snowy land, there are many who are skilled in the medical practices that have been spread and developed.

original: ma zhig 'ongs tshod du 'dug rung pandi ta smri ti phan tshun skad kyi brda ma 'phrod pas rta nag tu lug rdzi mdzad pa'i lo rgyus ltar ci yin cha ma 'tshal bar rang yul du phyir ldog ste gzhan phan gyi 'phrin las ma byung ba dang /
analyzed: ma zhig 'ongs tshod du 'dug rung pandi ta smri ti phan tshun skad kyi brda ma 'phrod pas rta nag tu lug rdzi mdzad pa'i lo rgyus ltar ci yin cha ma 'tshal bar rang yul du phyir ldog ste gzhan phan gyi 'phrin las ma byung ba dang /
translated: However, because the pandit Smritijnana and the Tibetan translator did not understand each other’s language, the pandit was left in Tanak as a shepherd.

original: la las tshe'i rig byed shes pa'i rna thos tsam go yang bod kyi gso rig pas chog shes pas /
analyzed: la las tshe'i rig byed shes pa'i rna thos tsam go yang bod kyi gso rig pas chog shes pas /
translated: Some people heard that he knew the science of longevity but thought Tibetan medicine was sufficient.

original: legs bshad rin po cher /
analyzed: legs bshad rin po cher /
translated: As it is said in the Precious Eloquence:

original: tsan dan gser las rin che ba //
analyzed: tsan dan gser las rin che ba //
translated: Tsanden is more precious than gold,

original: blun pos sol bar byas la ltos //
analyzed: blun pos sol bar byas la ltos //
translated: but fools make it into charcoal.

original: zhes pa ltar shes bzhin khyad gsod kyis dor ba'ang mchis rung rab byung bcu gcig pa'i shing 'brug gi lor sh'akya mu ne'i pho brang chen po'i mdun phyogs rgya gar ba'i mi rigs du ma tshogs khrod du sman pa mkhas pa zhig yod dam zer ba'i gtam thos
analyzed: zhes pa ltar shes bzhin khyad gsod kyis dor ba'ang mchis rung rab byung bcu gcig pa'i shing 'brug gi lor sh'akya mu ne'i pho brang chen po'i mdun phyogs rgya gar ba'i mi rigs du ma tshogs khrod du sman pa mkhas pa zhig yod dam zer ba'i gtam thos
translated: In the eleventh rabjung, the year of the wood dragon, in the midst of a gathering of many Indians in front of the great palace of Shakyamuni, someone asked whether there was a skilled physician among them.

original: pas rkyen byas 'dar pa lo chen dri mol byed du bcug pa 'phags yul nub phyogs ma hoo ra'i sa'i char bram ze gtsang @334a * //
analyzed: pas rkyen byas 'dar pa lo chen dri mol byed du bcug pa 'phags yul nub phyogs ma hoo ra'i sa'i char bram ze gtsang @334a * //
translated: The great translator Darma Drakpa was sent to India as a condition of the peace treaty. He went to the western part of India, to the land of Mahir, where he met the great scholar Vanaratna.🔽

original: ma'i rigs su skyes pa sam n+ya si go da ra ranytso ra ste khyim spangs sa spyod ces bya bas rgya gar dbus /🔽shar / nub /
analyzed: ma'i rigs su skyes pa sam n+ya si go da ra ranytso ra ste khyim spangs sa spyod ces bya bas rgya gar dbus / shar / nub /
translated: The great translator Darma Drakpa was sent to India to find out the truth. He discovered that in the western part of India, in the land of Maohor, there was a man born into a pure Brahmin family, Samantabhadra Ranjora, who had renounced his home and was wandering the earth.

original: lho // byang /🔽nee p'a la dang bcas pa chu bzhin myul nas slob dpon go ta ma bharthi /
analyzed: lho // byang / nee p'a la dang bcas pa chu bzhin myul nas slob dpon go ta ma bharthi /
translated: He had traveled to the center, east, west,🔽south, and north of India, as well as Nepal, like a fish in the water.

original: autt'a ma gi ri /🔽au k'a ra bharthi sogs gus pas bsten pa'i mkhas pa chen por rtog te 'dar ba pan chen gyis lo ts'a bgyis dar mo sman rams par bslab tu bcug par gso rig gi lag len ngo mtshar ba du ma byung rung phyogs 'dir mi rnyed pa'i sman gyi
analyzed: autt'a ma gi ri / au k'a ra bharthi sogs gus pas bsten pa'i mkhas pa chen por rtog te 'dar ba pan chen gyis lo ts'a bgyis dar mo sman rams par bslab tu bcug par gso rig gi lag len ngo mtshar ba du ma byung rung phyogs 'dir mi rnyed pa'i sman gyi
translated: He had studied with the great masters Gotama Bharti,🔽Uttaragiri, and Ukarabharti, and was considered a great scholar.

original: rigs 'tshol bar rgya bal phyogs su phyir bteg /
analyzed: rigs 'tshol bar rgya bal phyogs su phyir bteg /
translated: Darma Drakpa translated for him and Darmo Menrampa made him teach. He performed many amazing medical practices, but since the medicines he used could not be found in this region, he returned to India and Nepal to search for them.

original: bal po yam bu'i rgyal blon la rogs dan dgos tshul gyi sde pa'i hung rgya'i mtshams sbyor song ba la brten sman gyi rigs rnam grangs shin tu mang ba dang bcas me mo sprul lo'i dbyar 'byor pa'i rgya bal gyi slob dpon mkhas pa rnams kyi zhal gyi
analyzed: bal po yam bu'i rgyal blon la rogs dan dgos tshul gyi sde pa'i hung rgya'i mtshams sbyor song ba la brten sman gyi rigs rnam grangs shin tu mang ba dang bcas me mo sprul lo'i dbyar 'byor pa'i rgya bal gyi slob dpon mkhas pa rnams kyi zhal gyi
translated: The Depa sent Hunggi as an intermediary to the king and ministers of Nepal, asking for their help. As a result, the nectar of the mouths of the learned Indian and Nepalese masters who arrived in the summer of the female fire-snake year (1657) with a very large number of different types of medicines was collected into this essence of the vital points of the instructions on the science of life.

original: bdud rtsi las 'ongs pa'i tshe'i rigs byed kyi man ngag gnad kyi snying po bsdus pa 'di nyid mi chos gnad phreng las /
analyzed: bdud rtsi las 'ongs pa'i tshe'i rigs byed kyi man ngag gnad kyi snying po bsdus pa 'di nyid mi chos gnad phreng las /
translated: In the Garland of Essential Advice for Human Beings, it says:

original: sngon dus bod 'di srin po'i rgyal khams 'dra //
analyzed: sngon dus bod 'di srin po'i rgyal khams 'dra //
translated: In the past, Tibet was like a kingdom of rakshasas.

original: ding sang dus su rgya gar 'phags yul 'dra //
analyzed: ding sang dus su rgya gar 'phags yul 'dra //
translated: Now, in the present, it is like the holy land of India.

original: bsams kyin lo ts'a bod la dka' drin che //
analyzed: bsams kyin lo ts'a bod la dka' drin che //
translated: Thinking this, the lotsawas have been very kind to Tibet.

original: zhes dang / sa skya pandi tas /
analyzed: zhes dang / sa skya pandi tas /
translated: And Sakya Pandita said:

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gzhung lugs bla na med //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gzhung lugs bla na med //
translated: The supreme scriptural tradition of the sugatas

original: zhu chen sgyur byed mchan bu'i gnas thob pa //
analyzed: zhu chen sgyur byed mchan bu'i gnas thob pa //
translated: Is translated by the great lotsawas.

original: skad gnyis smra mkhas lo ts'a de dag ni //
analyzed: skad gnyis smra mkhas lo ts'a de dag ni //
translated: Those who are skilled in the two languages

original: de dag bdag cag rnams kyi mig bzhin gyur //
analyzed: de dag bdag cag rnams kyi mig bzhin gyur //
translated: Are like eyes for us.

original: zhes gsungs pa ltar /🔽p'a ni by'a ka ra na sogs sgra mdo chen po bzhi la blo gros kyi lang tsho mchog tu rgyas pa se dkar rigs kyi thig le 'dar pa lo ts'a ngag dbang phun tshogs lhun grub kyis bsgyur cing gso ba rig pa'i gzhung lugs la slob dpon mkhas
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ltar / p'a ni by'a ka ra na sogs sgra mdo chen po bzhi la blo gros kyi lang tsho mchog tu rgyas pa se dkar rigs kyi thig le 'dar pa lo ts'a ngag dbang phun tshogs lhun grub kyis bsgyur cing gso ba rig pa'i gzhung lugs la slob dpon mkhas
translated: As it says,

original: pa bcu phrag tsam bsten nas sbyangs pa'i yar stod dar mo sman rams pa blo bzang chos grags kyis 'bad pa chen pos gtan la phab pa'o //🔽chu gter slar yang ma bsrubs sngon med pa'i //
analyzed: pa bcu phrag tsam bsten nas sbyangs pa'i yar stod dar mo sman rams pa blo bzang chos grags kyis 'bad pa chen pos gtan la phab pa'o // chu gter slar yang ma bsrubs sngon med pa'i //
translated: the youth of intelligence is greatly expanded in the four great treatises of grammar, such as the Pāṇini, and the white lotus of the mind, the drop of the family, the translator Ngawang Phuntsok Lhundrup, having relied on about ten masters of the scriptures of the science of healing, with great effort composed this text.🔽When the ocean is churned again, the nectar of the Vedas,

original: rig byed bdud rtsi'i bum pa thob pa'i tshe //🔽mes pos dran pa'i gso dpyad dbyar skyes kyi //
analyzed: rig byed bdud rtsi'i bum pa thob pa'i tshe // mes pos dran pa'i gso dpyad dbyar skyes kyi //
translated: the previously unknown vase, is obtained.🔽At that time, the interest in the summer-born drum

original: rnga  gsangs de la mos pa cung zad lhod //
analyzed: rnga  gsangs de la mos pa cung zad lhod //
translated: of the medical practice remembered by the grandfather is slightly relaxed.

original: ti @334b se'i mdangs ltar rab dkar lhag pa'i yid //
analyzed: ti @334b se'i mdangs ltar rab dkar lhag pa'i yid //
translated: The white, superior mind, like the luster of the snow mountain,

original: lus can tshogs la rjes chags kunda'i tshal //
analyzed: lus can tshogs la rjes chags kunda'i tshal //
translated: is the jasmine grove of compassion for the assembly of embodied beings.

original: 'dzum pa'i cho ga gtong min sems bskyed kyi //
analyzed: 'dzum pa'i cho ga gtong min sems bskyed kyi //
translated: The wind of compassion, which is the cause of the rain of Dharma,

original: bsil sbyin mkhan po'i cha shas nye bar dgang //
analyzed: bsil sbyin mkhan po'i cha shas nye bar dgang //
translated: Is the spreading of the branches of the master of the cooling tree.

original: phyogs brgyar zegs ma 'thor ba kashbu ra'i //
analyzed: phyogs brgyar zegs ma 'thor ba kashbu ra'i //
translated: The drops that fall in a hundred directions are the Kshaburis.

original: dad pas tsha gdung bcil la mtshar 'dzin na //
analyzed: dad pas tsha gdung bcil la mtshar 'dzin na //
translated: If you are amazed at the cooling of the heat of faith,

original: yongs grub brgya dang rtsa gcig bro nad gnyen //
analyzed: yongs grub brgya dang rtsa gcig bro nad gnyen //
translated: The one hundred and one branches of the perfected tree are the friend of illness.

original: sman gyi dpag bsam 'khri shing 'di sus bskrun //
analyzed: sman gyi dpag bsam 'khri shing 'di sus bskrun //
translated: Who created this wish-granting tree of medicine?

original: ris su mchad 'gro ba 'jigs bral ba'i //🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin rdzogs rgyal sras kyi //
analyzed: ris su mchad 'gro ba 'jigs bral ba'i // sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin rdzogs rgyal sras kyi //
translated: The one who is free from the fear of the realms is the bodhisattva.

original: rlabs chen spyod la 'jug rnams sangs rgyas zhes //
analyzed: rlabs chen spyod la 'jug rnams sangs rgyas zhes //
translated: The one who enters into the great waves of conduct is the Buddha.

original: grags can bgrod dka'i sa de mi ring snyam //
analyzed: grags can bgrod dka'i sa de mi ring snyam //
translated: I think that the famous and difficult stage is not far away.🔽The illness of the unbearable and intense feeling of suffering,

original: bzod min tshor ba drag po'i nad gnod dang // de rgyu sgrib gnyis lus pa med bcas pa //
analyzed: bzod min tshor ba drag po'i nad gnod dang // de rgyu sgrib gnyis lus pa med bcas pa //
translated: And the cause of that, the two obscurations, are completely destroyed.

original: 'joms pa'i sman pa ches mchog rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: 'joms pa'i sman pa ches mchog rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: The supreme doctor who accomplishes this is the perfect Buddha.

original: 'grub pa'i skal pa bzang por bdag 'gyur shog /
analyzed: 'grub pa'i skal pa bzang por bdag 'gyur shog /
translated: May I have the good fortune to accomplish this.

original: tsan dan 'byug dang te'us brdeg pa la //
analyzed: tsan dan 'byug dang te'us brdeg pa la //
translated: Anointing with sandalwood and beating with a stick,

original: snyoms par zhal 'che'i thugs rje snyigs dus 'dir //
analyzed: snyoms par zhal 'che'i thugs rje snyigs dus 'dir //
translated: In this degenerate age, may the compassion of the Buddhas,🔽Who are in meditative equipoise, be aroused

original: bskul na 'jig rten gsum gyi du:kha rnams //🔽mkhyen brtse nus pas pha mthar mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: bskul na 'jig rten gsum gyi du:kha rnams // mkhyen brtse nus pas pha mthar mdzad du gsol //
translated: To pacify the three worlds' sufferings.

original: 'gro mang srog zungs bcud len bdud rtsi'i gter //
analyzed: 'gro mang srog zungs bcud len bdud rtsi'i gter //
translated: May the nectar-like elixir of life,

original: myangs pa'i 'bras bu nam mkhas gzhal dka' ba'i //🔽dge tshogs ma lus mtha' bral sems can kun //
analyzed: myangs pa'i 'bras bu nam mkhas gzhal dka' ba'i // dge tshogs ma lus mtha' bral sems can kun //
translated: Which is the fruit of the practice of the teachings,🔽Be dedicated to the attainment of enlightenment

original: bla med byang chub 'thob pa'i rgyu ru bsngo //
analyzed: bla med byang chub 'thob pa'i rgyu ru bsngo //
translated: By all beings, who are free from the extremes of existence and non-existence.

original: zhes tshe'i rig byed mtha' dag gi snying po bsdus pa'i glegs bam gyi che brjod bsgyur byang smon lam gyi rim pa 'di ni za hor gyi bande tshangs sras bzhad pa'i rdo rjes dmar ser can gyi lo khrums kyi zla ba'i dkar cha'i rgyal ba dang po'i tshes
analyzed: zhes tshe'i rig byed mtha' dag gi snying po bsdus pa'i glegs bam gyi che brjod bsgyur byang smon lam gyi rim pa 'di ni za hor gyi bande tshangs sras bzhad pa'i rdo rjes dmar ser can gyi lo khrums kyi zla ba'i dkar cha'i rgyal ba dang po'i tshes
translated: This preface to the book, which is a compendium of the essence of all the scriptures on longevity, was composed by the Bengali monk Tsong-kha-pa bZhad-pa'i rdo-rje, on the first day of the waxing moon of the twelfth month of the year of the red-brown female earth-hare (1399)

original: la rgyal khab chen po po ta lar sbyar ba'i yi ge pa ni dge slong 'jam dbyangs grags pas bgyis pa dza yantu /
analyzed: la rgyal khab chen po po ta lar sbyar ba'i yi ge pa ni dge slong 'jam dbyangs grags pas bgyis pa dza yantu /
translated: in the great country of Tibet, at the Potala Palace. The scribe was the monk 'Jam-dbyangs grags-pa.
